0P000070E2.TO.summary: The primary objective of the fund is to provide safety of capital with a reasonable level of current income. The fund invests in government treasury bills, certificates of deposit of chartered banks, short-term bonds and other low-risk commercial paper. It is currently invested mainly in treasury bills and Canadian Government Bonds.
0P000070E2.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Berube has more than 10 years of investment experience.

0P000070U1.TO.summary: The fund's objective is to conserve capital and maximize income.
0P000070U1.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Berube has more than 10 years of investment experience.

0P000070V7.TO.long_name: Canada Life No-Load Money Market (Portico) Gens
0P000070V7.TO.summary: The fund objective is to provide short-term capital preservation and interest income through investments in commercial papers such as federal and provincial treasury bills and bankers' acceptances.

0P00007127.TO.summary: To maximize interest income while preserving capital and maintaining liquidity by investing primarily in high quality, short-term debt securities issued by the Government of Canada or any Canadian provincial government, obligations of Canadian banks and trust companies, and commercial paper with an approved credit rating.

0P000074NV.TO.summary: The objective of this fund is to make available the capital protection and high-liquidity of the short-term money markets in Canada and to earn the highest returns available with minimal exposure to risk.
0P000074NV.TO.manager_bio: Barbara Berry, Senior Trader, Money Market, joined AEGON Capital Management Inc. in 1996, and is responsible for cash management for all funds. She began her career in 1991 as Assistant Manager, Investor Financing, at The Intellivest Group, and then moved to Northam Realty Ltd. in 1995. Barbara graduated from the University of Western Ontario with a BA In Administrative and Commercial Studies and Finance & Economics in 1991, and is a Level II candidate in the Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) program.

0P000074QZ.TO.summary: The investment objective is to provide a secure source of moderate interest income by investing in Canadian short-term money market instruments and cash.
0P000074QZ.TO.manager_bio: In 2006, Mark was promoted to the position of Assistant Portfolio Manager, Money Markets. He is responsible for managing Co-operators $350 million money market portfolios in accordance with the bond team strategy, performing bond analysis as required and managing our currency hedge programs. Mark joined Co-operators in 2004 as a Money Market Trader/Fixed Income Analyst. Prior to that, he was the Director of Analysis at Morningstar Research in Toronto. He worked with Morningstar and its predecessor company in progressively senior roles since 1998.

The Fund may not change its fundamental investment objectives without the approval of a majority of the Unitholders of the Fund, at a meeting called for this purpose.

0P00008YER.TO.summary: The fundamental investment objectives of the Steadyhand Savings Fund are to achieve a reasonably stable level of current income while also seeking to preserve capital. The fund invests primarily in Canadian dollar denominated money market securities and short-term debt obligations issued by the federal and provincial governments of Canada, as well as high-quality shortterm debt obligations issued by Canadian corporations.
0P00008YER.TO.manager_bio: 1998-Present:Brian is a Vice President and Director of Connor, Clark & Lunn Investment Management Ltd. 1987-1998: Scotia Capital Markets. As Director responsible for proprietary trading and institutional fixed income sales. As Vice President he was responsible for debt underwriting, private placements and structured notes. Deputy Representative for Asian market, based in Tokyo. Eurobond and Provincial bond trader. 1985-1986: Eurobond Trader, Wood Gundy Inc., London England.

0P0000OQ7L.TO.long_name: Manulife SI Ideal Money Market Fund GLWB
0P0000OQ7L.TO.summary: The investment objective of the Ideal Money Market Fund is to provide policyholders with a low-risk, secure source of interest income based on current money market yields by investing primarily in Canadian money market instruments and cash.
0P0000OQ7L.TO.manager_bio:
As Money Market Manager, Sharron Southin is responsible for all money market investments, foreign exchange transactions and cash operations. She is actively involved in the management of bond portfolios and trading, and is responsible for business continuity.
Sharron joined Standard Life Investments Inc. as a Fixed Income Assistant In 1993. She was promoted to the role of Bond and Money Market Trader in 1997 and subsequently appointed to her current position in 1999.
Sharron holds a Chartered Financial Analyst designation and a Bachelor of Commerce degree (Finance) from Concordia University.
0P0000OQ7L.TO.family: Standard Life Assurance Co. of Canada

0P0000PSUN.TO.long_name: Ninepoint Short Term Bond Fund Series A
0P0000PSUN.TO.summary: The objective of this Fund is to maximize yield on cash balances, while providing easy access to investments with daily liquidity. The Fund invests in high interest savings accounts offered at Schedule 1 Canadian Banks.
0P0000PSUN.TO.manager_bio: Scott joined Sprott Asset Management LP in March 2010 and brings over 25 years of global fixed income and currency market experience to the firm. He is a four-time winner of the Best Foreign Bond Fund* at the Morningstar Canadian Investment Awards. Scott began his career at the Bank of Canada where he worked in both research and trading which assisted in the execution of monetary policy. Scott is a CFA charterholder and has an MBA from University of Toronto and an Honours BA from Queens University.

0P00011WTZ.TO.summary: The Canadian Money Market Fund utilizes a fund-on-fund approach by investing in units of the Manulife Canadian Money Market Fund. The Manulife Canadian Money Market Fund maintains the objective of achieving a high level of interest income while preserving capital and maintaining liquidity, primarily through investments in money market securities guaranteed by the Government of Canada, its Provinces or Municipalities, corporations and chartered banks.
0P00011WTZ.TO.manager_bio: Faisal Rahman, CFA, is a managing director and portfolio manager, Canadian Money Market for Manulife Investment Management. He is lead manager of the Money Market investment management team, which is responsible for money market management for institutional and sub-advised mandates in both Canada and the United States. Faisal joined the Money Market team in 2001 as assistant portfolio manager and has progressed on the team since then to his current level of responsibility.

0P0001FVKA.TO.summary: The fundamental objective of the fund is to seek to generate interest income. The fund invests in high quality, short-term fixed income securities issued by Canadian federal or provincial governments, Canadian chartered banks, and loan, trust and other companies operating in Canada. The fund may also invest in interest-rate bearing instruments such as demand deposit accounts.
0P0001FVKA.TO.manager_bio: Faisal Rahman, CFA, is a managing director and portfolio manager, Canadian Money Market for Manulife Investment Management. He is lead manager of the Money Market investment management team, which is responsible for money market management for institutional and sub-advised mandates in both Canada and the United States. Faisal joined the Money Market team in 2001 as assistant portfolio manager and has progressed on the team since then to his current level of responsibility.
